question: Mudra Rakshas is a work of Vishakhadutta. This work was depicted which of the following?
explanation: The Mudrarakshasa is a Sanskrit-language play by Vishakhadatta that narrates the ascent of the king Chandragupta Maurya. It is dated variously from the late 4th century to the 8th century CE. This work depicted Mauryas and Nandas.
